page.title: 09HEALTH
page.content: A Medical Centre was opened in 1969 and was extended in 1984. The area needs to develop better facilities for the elderly. Shadon House caters for only forty elderly residents. 1% of the population of Birtley seeks help. Some suffer from depression and there are cases of alcoholism. There is some child abuse and cases of glue sniffing exspecially among unemployed teenagers. Birtley has the largest children's Home in Gateshead. It deals with fostering, difficult behaviour, and assessment of children's needs. There is one hostel in the Borough for the physically handicapped with forty places. The local hospital is the Queen Elizabeth just outside of Birtley.
